name: Picaflor de Los Andes
description:
'''Víctor Alberto Gil Mallma''' (April 8, 1928 in [[Ayacucho]] – July 14, 1975 in [[Lima]]), better known as '''Picaflor de Los Andes''', was a [[Peru]]vian [[folk singer]]. In his childhood, he worked as a driver, painter, construction worker, and bricklayer.  He sold approximately 80,000 copies of the single "Corazón mañoso" in 1960, thereby becoming a cultural icon and obtaining the name "Picaflor de los Andes".

He died on July 14, 1975, in the district of [[La Oroya]]; there were more than 100,000 people at his burial.
